TopicTitle: Mission Museum in upgraded Admin building

Articles.Content:
I'm still a noob, having only played the game on and off for about a year (since ... the one before 0.90 ...0.25?), and haven't done more than a few hundred launches in any one game, so maybe this idea is impractical. Anyway, here it is for your consideration.

Snapshots: it would be cool to have a place in the game to look at, organize, caption, and maybe post them to image-sharing places.

What I propose is that the first upgrade to the Admin building adds on a Mission Museum, where you can do these things.

The sales pitch:

For players, it gives a reason to go into the Admin building more than once or twice a game, and adds another facet to an already fascinating game.

For Squad, it makes it easier for people to spread word of mouth about the game (the "post them to image-sharing places" bit). I know that a lot of current players are already quite happy to delve into the Snapshots folder outside of the game, and edit and post snapshots manually, but making it easier can't hurt -- especially when the game is ported to consoles.

Hey, this thread woke up while I was trying to crack the password on my wife's dictation machine (she knows, she wants me to crack it! )! Cool!

Some people are saying "you can already do that". Yes, that's right, you can, if you are motivated enough. But making it easier and more fun, more in-game, will mean that more people do it. And that can only be good, right?

And besides, Walt has to have something to do in that fancy hazmat suit of his. PR doesn't seem to be stretching him at present. He can be the tour guide/curator for the museum.

Rather than having the museum a part of the Admin Building I'd prefer to have a dedicated Visitor Complex that would display:

- Milestones / achievements / records (e.g. first Kerbal to go to space, highest altitude, longest duration flight, heaviest craft launched)

- A Hall of samples collected from various biomes and celestial bodies (e.g. beaker of liquid from Laythe's oceans, Munar rock sample)

- A Hall of vessels and crafts

It would also be nice to have players control a generic visitor Kerbal in third-person view to walk around the various exhibits, which would be much better than simply listing them on a page.
